title: Supreme Court strikes down Trump's sweeping global tariffs
partialText: The ruling opens the door to potentially hundreds of billions of dollars in tariff refunds.

title: KFC, Nando's, and others ditch chicken welfare pledge
partialText: Wingstop, Burger King, and others have walked away from an industry commitment to avoid using fast-growing chickens

title: Higher tax helped UK government reach record January surplus
partialText: The government took in more from tax receipts than expected, official data suggests.

title: New Year's sport supplement buying adds to January retail sales surge
partialText: Continuing strong sales from online jewellers after a recent spike in gold prices also helped drive the increase.

title: Lobbying firm co-founded by Mandelson goes into administration
partialText: Global Counsel's clients cut ties with the firm over Lord Mandelson's links with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: How do you modernise mango farming?
partialText: India's mango farmers are being urged to innovate as climate change makes cultivation "unpredictable".

title: US economy slows in final months after turbulent year
partialText: Overall the economy grew 2.2% last year, holding up despite pressures from changes to tariff and immigration policy.

title: Asos co-founder dies after Thailand apartment block fall
partialText: Quentin Griffiths co-founded Asos in 2000 and remained a significant shareholder after leaving the firm five years later.

title: Epstein eyed record label investment to access women, files suggest
partialText: His associate said the music industry was "related to P", a way Epstein apparently often referred to women.

title: Starmer 'appeasing' big tech firms, says online safety campaigner
partialText: Baroness Kidron tells the BBC the PM has being "late to the party" in regulating social media.

title: Live Nation sees strong ticket sales as monopoly lawsuit looms
partialText: The entertainment giant's revenue surged last year as 159 million fans attended its concerts.

title: Nasa boss says Boeing Starliner failure one of worst in its history
partialText: The agency released a critical report that puts the Starliner incident at same mistake level assigned to the fatal Columbia and Challenger shuttle disasters.

title: The Chinese AI app sending Hollywood into a panic
partialText: Clips of Deadpool and other film characters have sparked alarm within Hollywood over copyright infringement.

title: US and Indonesia finalise deal to cut tariffs to 19%
partialText: Washington will set a 19% tariff on most Indonesian goods in exchange for lower trade barriers for US goods

title: US trade deficit hits fresh high despite Trump's tariffs
partialText: The US bought more goods than it sold in 2025 as the White House attempts to reverse the flow.

title: Warmer weather hits profits at British Gas owner
partialText: Savvy bill payers shopping around for fixed-tariff energy deals also dented earnings at British Gas.

title: Why there's no quick fix in sight for the problem of dazzling headlights
partialText: Road users say headlight glare is an issue - but experts warn a solution might not be straightforward.

title: Microsoft error sees confidential emails exposed to AI tool Copilot
partialText: The company says it has addressed the issue and it "did not provide anyone access to information they weren't already authorised to see".

title: Etsy sells second-hand fashion app Depop to eBay for $1.2bn
partialText: The "pre-loved" fashion firm has been sold by Etsy just five years after it bought the firm.

title: Reeves fixated on 'dysfunctional' borrowing rules, says IFS
partialText: The think tank suggests the chancellor's fiscal rules need to shift the focus from one key figure.

title: 'We're still on edge': Toy firms look to US Supreme Court as tariffs hit profits
partialText: "You cannot go to sleep on this president," says one toymaker, of the ongoing uncertainty over trade policy.

title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
partialText: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
partialText: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

title: Bill Gates pulls out of India's AI summit over Epstein files controversy
partialText: The Gates Foundation said the decision was made to "ensure the focus remains on the summit's key priorities".

title: Dennis the Menace featured on 50p coin to mark 75 years
partialText: The new coin has been made with with Beano, Britain's longest-running weekly comic, first published in 1938

title: Pubs to open late for home nations  World Cup knockout games
partialText: Football fans will be able to enjoy an extra round at the pub thanks to new rules during the men's World Cup.

title: Trump adviser calls for Fed economists to be 'disciplined'
partialText: Kevin Hassett criticised a New York Fed study into tariffs and the impact on US firms and consumers.

title: The two farms in Senegal that supply many of the UK's vegetables
partialText: During winter in Britain fresh produce is sent by cargo ship from the West African nation every week.

title: Reddit's human content wins amid the AI flood
partialText: Reddit says its human contributors are valued amid an internet awash with AI-generated content.

title: Trump eyes Venezuela visit – but obstacles to his oil plan remain
partialText: The US president wants American energy firms to start extracting the crude but they are reluctant.

title: Get a grip: Robotics firms struggle to develop hands
partialText: Developing a durable and affordable hand is one of the biggest challenges in robotics.

title: Who is billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe and how did he make his money?
partialText: The industrialist and Manchester United co-owner has apologised over comments he made about immigration.

title: The US economy is growing - so where are all the jobs?
partialText: As hiring rates and job openings drop, some worry a tough job market could be here to stay.

title: The Dutch love four-day working weeks, but are they sustainable?
partialText: The Netherlands has the lowest working hours in Europe, but some say it is harming its economy.

title: Why food fraud persists, even with improving tech
partialText: Even with sophisticated technology it is still difficult to detect fake foods.

title: Netflix and Paramount are battling for Warner Bros. Who is likely to win?
partialText: What to know about the two firms' blockbuster battle to control Warner Bros Discovery.

title: How £50m 'fish disco' could save farmland
partialText: Innovative tech scares fish away from nuclear cooling pipes.

title: Plane makers chase Asia's super-rich with luxe new private jets
partialText: Parts of the aviation industry are shifting towards wealthy customers and selling a more luxurious type of international travel.

title: Higher tax helped UK government reach record January surplus
partialText: The government took in more from tax receipts than expected, official data suggests.

title: Closing factory workers paid to help at food bank
partialText: Dutch coffee-making giant Jacobs Douwe Egberts (JDE) will close its plant in Banbury this year.

title: Warmer weather hits profits at British Gas owner
partialText: Savvy bill payers shopping around for fixed-tariff energy deals also dented earnings at British Gas.

title: Are UK interest rates expected to fall soon?
partialText: The interest rate set by the Bank of England affects mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions.

title: Why are UK prices still rising?
partialText: UK Inflation has dropped back from record highs but remains above the Bank of England's 2% target.

title: The real impact of roadworks on the country - and why they're set to get worse
partialText: There is a fine balance between the benefits of improved infrastructure, versus the cost of disruption. Does the country have it right?

title: Why the railways often seem to be in such chaos over Christmas
partialText: Parts of Britain’s rail network will close for engineering work over the festive period - but is that the right time to do it?

title: Budget 2025: What's the best and worst that could happen for Labour?
partialText: Three days in, after a tax U-turn and partial climbdown on workers' rights, Laura Kuenssberg looks at what impact Budget week might have.

title: Has Britain's budget watchdog become too all-powerful?
partialText: Ahead of this week's Budget, some have accused the Office for Budget Responsibility of being a "straitjacket on growth"

title: The curious case of why Poundland is struggling during a cost-of-living crisis
partialText: Why - in an age where so many of us are feeling the financial pinch - are some budget shops on UK high streets having such a tough time?

title: When the retail staff can't help you
partialText: This customer might be feeling trolled, in this scene from Small Prophets.

title: Why youth unemployment is rising
partialText: Unemployment in the UK rose to its highest rate in nearly five years at the end of 2025

title: Why you should consider switching bank accounts
partialText: Martin Lewis explains why now might be a good time to think about changing your bank account.

title: Thousands queue as beauty store arrives on island of Ireland
partialText: Almost 2,000 people joined the queue for the opening of a new store in Belfast this morning.
